    Example of anisotropic landscapes

    Hervé Guillon

    16 January 2021

    zeta_examples.Rmd

    Purpose

    This vignette displays the calculation of anisotropy exponent for different landscapes.

    Gabilan Mesa

    gabilan_mesa <- raster::raster(file.path(system.file("extdata/rasters/", package = "statisticalRoughness"), "gabilan_mesa.tif"))
summary(gabilan_mesa)
#>      Length       Class        Mode 
#>       90000 RasterLayer          S4
results <- get_zeta(gabilan_mesa)

    \(\beta_1\) \(\beta_2\) \(1/f_c\) \(\alpha_{1,x}\) \(\alpha_{1,y}\) \(\zeta_{1}\) \(\alpha_{2,x}\) \(\alpha_{2,y}\) \(\zeta_2\) \(r_c\) \(r_{max}\) \(\theta_x\) \(\theta_y\)
    -2.19 -5.53 238 0.852 0.792 1.08 0.342 0.337 1.01 126 405 123 32.9

    Yosemite

    yosemite <- raster::raster(file.path(system.file("extdata/rasters/", package = "statisticalRoughness"), "yosemite.tif"))
summary(yosemite)
#>      Length       Class        Mode 
#>       90000 RasterLayer          S4
results <- get_zeta(yosemite)

    \(\beta_1\) \(\beta_2\) \(1/f_c\) \(\alpha_{1,x}\) \(\alpha_{1,y}\) \(\zeta_{1}\) \(\alpha_{2,x}\) \(\alpha_{2,y}\) \(\zeta_2\) \(r_c\) \(r_{max}\) \(\theta_x\) \(\theta_y\)
    -4.97 -4.25 440 0.872 0.739 1.18 0.498 0.52 1.04 602 1250 121 30.8

    Modoc

    modoc <- raster::raster(file.path(system.file("extdata/rasters/", package = "statisticalRoughness"), "modoc.tif"))
summary(modoc)
#>      Length       Class        Mode 
#>       90000 RasterLayer          S4
results <- get_zeta(modoc)

    \(\beta_1\) \(\beta_2\) \(1/f_c\) \(\alpha_{1,x}\) \(\alpha_{1,y}\) \(\zeta_{1}\) \(\alpha_{2,x}\) \(\alpha_{2,y}\) \(\zeta_2\) \(r_c\) \(r_{max}\) \(\theta_x\) \(\theta_y\)
    -2.48 -5.27 588 0.869 0.868 1 0.631 0.819 1.3 955 1820 91.6 1.59
